claim_attributed: SCATSAT-1 is an Earth observation satellite developed by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), launched in 2016 as a continuity mission to Oceansat-2's scattering radar altimeter payload for providing wind vector data products for weather forecasting, cyclone detection and tracking services. The satellite carries a Ku-band Scatterometer similar to the one flown onboard Oceansat-2. It was launched aboard the PSLV (Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle) on its 56th flight and operated for various weather monitoring and oceanographic applications until data services were discontinued due to an irrecoverable TWTA instrument failure on 28 February 2021. Near-real time level two ocean wind vectors are available through the e-portal of EUMETSAT based on ScatSat-1's backscatter measurements.
